intro: Elaeoselinum asclepium var. meoides, commonly known as the meadow elecampane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks. The roots of this plant are known for their medicinal properties and have been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
